content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a simple implementation of your request:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all indices of the code blocks
    starts = findall("```julia", md) .+ 8
    ends = findall("```", md, 10:end) .- 1
    
    # Extract code blocks and remove code fences
    codes = map(i -> strip(md[starts[i]:ends[i]]), 1:length(starts))
    
    # Join the code blocks together with a newline
    return join(codes, "\n")
end
```
This function uses string indexing to find all occurrences of ```julia and ``` in your markdown. It then extracts the corresponding segments and joins them together. Note that it doesn't handle nested code fences or any other more complex scenarios; for these, a more advanced parser would be necessary.
